Package LinAlg

Class Number

java.lang.Object
LinAlg.Number
public class Number
extends java.lang.Object
This class allows for the creation of complex and real numbers and provides methods for computation with those numbers.
Author:
Jacob Watters

    • random

      public static Number random()
      Generates a random real number.
      Returns:
      random real number

    • random

      public static Number random​(double mag)
      Generates a random complex number with given magnitude. Note: the magnitude must be a non-negative real number.
      Parameters:
      mag - - magnitude
      Returns:
      random complex number with specified magnitude.

    • random

      public static Number random​(double min, double max, boolean... magnitude_flag)
      Generates a random number bewtween min and max. If magnitude_flag is passesd a true, then a random complex number with magnitude between min and max (where min and max are non-negative values) is generated. If magnitude_flag is passesd a false, then a random real value between min and max is generated. If no magnitude_flag is passed, then it is treated as false.
      Parameters:
      min - - minimum value for random number
      max - - maximum value for random number
      magnitude_flag - - optional flag to indicate if the Number should be real or complex.
      Returns:
      random real or complex number between min and max.

    • conjugate

      public static Number conjugate​(Number a)
      Computes and returns complex conjugate of a complex number. For example the complex conjugate of a+bi is a-bi.
      Parameters:
      a - - complex number
      Returns:
      complex conjugate of a

      Returns:

    • abs

      public static Number abs​(Number value)
      Computes absolute value of a complex number. Note, this will alwayse result in a non-negative real number.
      Parameters:
      value - - value to take absolute value of.
      Returns:
      The absolute value of the number.

    • inv

      public static Number inv​(Number value)
      Computes the inverse of a Number. For example, given a number n, the inverse is 1/n. This is equivalent to Number.divide(Number.ONE, value);
      Parameters:
      value - - Number to take inverse of
      Returns:
      - Inverse of value

    • pow

      public static Number pow​(Number base, int exponenent)
      Preforms complex expinentiation of two numbers. Note: base can be any complex number. TODO: Extend this using to complex numbers using Talyor series expansion of e^x. (May need a new method exponenent())
      Parameters:
      base - - base of exponential expresion
      exponenent - - exponent of exponential expression
      Returns:
      Result of the exponential expresion base^exponenent

    • pow

      public static Number pow​(Number base, Number exponent)
      Preforms complex expinentiation of two numbers. Note: The exponent, must be a real integer. TODO: Extend this using to complex numbers using Talyor series expansion of e^x. (May need a new method exp())
      Parameters:
      base - - base of exponential expresion
      exponent - - exponent of exponential expression
      Returns:
      Result of the exponential expresion base^exp

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Number b)
      Checks for equvalence between two complex numbers
      Parameters:
      b - - Number to check equivalency to
      Returns:
      True if the two numbers are equivalent. Otherwise, returns false.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Number b)
      Compares the size of two complex numbers (magnitues).
      Parameters:
      b - - Number to compare
      Returns:
      - If the magnitude of this number is equal to that of b, then this method will return 0.
      - If the magnitude of this number is less than that of b, then this method will return a negative number.
      - If the magnitude of this number is greator than that of b, then this method will return a positive number.

    • compareToReal

      public int compareToReal​(Number b)
      Compares the real value of two numbers.
      Parameters:
      b - - Number to compare
      Returns:
      - If the real value of this number is equal to that of b, then this method will return 0.
      - If the real value of this number is less than that of b, then this method will return a negative number.
      - If the real value of this number is greator than that of b, then this method will return a positive number.
